post_body:
By default, all HubSpot contacts except those with a Lifecycle Stage of Subscriber will sync to Salesforce. However, if you create an inclusion list in HubSpot, all default behavior will be overridden and only contacts in your inclusion list will sync from HubSpot to Salesforce.

Related articles:

  • What is Lifecycle Stage?
  • How can I limit which contacts show up in Salesforce?

Salesforce inclusion lists must be smart lists, which means that contacts cannot be manually added to the list. Smart lists are based on criteria, so contacts must meet the criteria to qualify for the list. See this article for help adjusting your Salesforce inclusion list criteria in order to include the correct contacts.

Related articles:

  • How can I limit which contacts show up in Salesforce?
  • How do I add and remove contacts from lists?

In order to create successful Companies Reports, verify the following settings for HubSpot and Salesforce.

  • Company sync is enabled
    • Navigate to Contacts > Contacts Settings > Salesforce Connector > Settings.
    • Under 'Account Sync', verify that the dropdown is set to 'Sync Accounts'.
    • If you have not yet enabled Account sync, learn more about this settings.
  • Company properties are correctly mapped
    • Navigate to Contacts > Contacts Settings > Salesforce Connector > Company Field Mappings.
    • Confirm that any properties that you wish to report on are correctly mapped between HubSpot and Salesforce.

As highlighted below, when trying to save an email one may see an error noted as error parsing html style information.

Such error is caused from either content not coded appropriately, or extraneous code that was added to the email which is does not bode well with the content and/or isn't formatted appropriately. Now, in order to review the body of the email in a coded format you will have to make use of the Source Code icon as highlighted below.

  • Navigate to Content > Email, locate the email in question and access it for editing.
  • Scroll down to the Main Email Body module, and click on the Source Code icon - Doing so will allow you to review the email's content in a coded format.
  • When ready, click on Done followed by Save.

Please be sure to also review any other Rich Text modules your email contains at the Email Editor level (as exemplified above) or Template level. If the error persists, please contact our Support Team for further assistance.

Rank is an approximation of your website's position for a particular search term in a search engines' results pages. The lower the rank, the easier your website is to find in search results for that keyword.

Please note: search engines may factor personalization and localization into their results, which can influence ranking on a search by search basis.

Related articles:

  • Understanding Keywords
  • How to use the Keywords dashboard
  • Why did a keyword's rank suddenly drop?

• If the contact property value is blank for the contact you are testing personalization for, the default value for that contact property will be displayed instead.
  • If in addition to the above you do not have a default value set, CONTACT.PROPERTYNAME will be displayed instead in the test email/preview, and no value or blank space will be displayed in the live email send.

Related Articles : How do I preview email personalization?, How do I create default values for my email personalization tokens?

Conversion Assists has been replaced with the Attribution Report for all Professional and Enterprise customers.

This new report is available under Reports > Reports Home > Create a New Report > 'Attribution Report'. Follow a step by step guide for creating an Attribution Report.

HubSpot does not include out of the box functionality to edit the form validation message. It is possible to accomplish this type of customization by using the form embed code and modifying the JavaScript. You may also write a custom script to load on the page and replace the default validation message. Both of these options require the help of a developer who knows how to write JavaScript, and HubSpot Support cannot support this type of customization.

Please see this resource for more detailed information about customizing the form embed code.

Related articles:

  • How do I customize my form's JavaScript and HTML?
  • Does HubSpot have the ability to add field validation on forms?

Four smart lists are created within the lists application when a persona is created.

  • The default naming convention for these lists is "[Persona Name] Persona - [Lifecycle Stage]"
  • Therefore if you create a persona called Marketing Mary, the four lists would be:
    • Marketing Mary Persona - Customers
    • Marketing Mary Persona - Leads
    • Marketing Mary Persona - MQLs
    • Marketing Mary Persona - All Contacts
  • These lists are created in order to highlight the number of contacts in various lifecycle stages in each persona.
  • The lists are not editable and cannot be deleted.
    • You can create a new folder in your lists tool and add all the persona lists to this folder if you find they take up too much space on the List Dashboard.

Some possible reasons for the error "Your email was sent but no contacts were included" :

  • Contacts were removed from the recipient list (ie. Contacts were removed manually, or smart list criteria was modified resulting in contacts being removed from the list.)
  • Identical recipient and exclusion lists
  • All contacts on recipient list are ineligible

If you are experiencing a different issue than the above please contact HubSpot Support.

In rare circumstances, you may find a Call-to-Action (CTA) button, one originally intended to show only once on a HubSpot page, to actually appear two times, either right next to or on top of each other. This is caused by an additional anchor tag surrounding the CTA token within the source code.

In order to resolve this particular issue, you will need to remove the anchor tag surrounding the CTA, only leaving the CTA token. Please follow the steps detailed below to successfully remove the unnecessary anchor tag.

  • Navigate to the HubSpot page in question, and select to edit it
  • Locate the specific module containing the double representation of the CTA
  • Click on the Source Code icon in order to review the module's source code
  • As exemplified below, the CTA token, {% raw %}{{cta('e76830f3-d29c-455d-a918-f079802751b3')}}{% endraw %}, is surrounded by an anchor tag (<a href="http:....><img class="hs-cta-img" id="hs-cta-img-...." style="border-width:0px;" src="https://......" /></a>)
  • Delete the unnecessary anchor tag, only leaving the CTA token:

Completing these steps will ensure the CTA is only rendered once. However, in the case these troubleshooting steps prove difficult or unsuccessful, please contact our HubSpot Support Team for further assistance.

By default, HubSpot fields are set to update Salesforce only if there is no value in the corresponding field. This means that in most cases, if HubSpot attempts to update a Salesforce field that already contains a value, the value in HubSpot will be overwritten with the value in Salesforce. If you would like to change this setting, meaning when HubSpot should update data to the corresponding Salesforce field, please follow the directions noted below.

  • Navigate to your Account Menu > Integrations.
  • Click on Settings under your Salesforce Integration.
  • On the following page, click on Contacts Field Mappings.
  • Under the Contact Field Mappings page you will find all of the field mappings between your HubSpot portal and Salesforce instance - Locate the field mapping you would like to edit.
  • Once you find the field mapping in question, click on the its corresponding Gear Icon > select Edit.
  • Under When should HubSpot data update the corresponding Salesforce field? select one of the following:
  • Always - The most recent data from either system will populate the field. So, if for example, HubSpot has the latest data for the field in question, a HubSpot sync will overwrite whatever value is found in that field in Salesforce.
  • Only if blank in Salesforce - A value will overwrite a blank field found in Salesforce. In other words, if Salesforce already has the data, the field in Salesforce is left untouched.
  • Never - A HubSpot sync will never overwrite any value, including null, found in that property. Salesforce will only update the HubSpot property.
  • I never want data to pass between these fields - This option is basically for the case you no longer want the fields to sync.

Related Articles:

  • What do the different update rules for my field mappings mean?
  • How to map contact properties between HubSpot and Salesforce

By default, HubSpot will place cookies on the domain level, so this type of tracking setup requires additional steps.

If you have multiple HubSpot accounts with subdomains that you wish to track separately, please contact HubSpot Support to help update your cookie settings.

• HubSpot has given you the ability to display your SurveyMonkey information in Salesforce via the HubSpot Intelligence visualforce element that is automatically installed with HubSpot
    • If you have not added the HubSpot Intelligence element to your page layouts, you can see how do to that here
  • On the HubSpot Intelligence of the lead or contact that has filled out a survey, you will now see an item for surveys filled out, as well as a blue hyperlink with the name of the survey

Within this window, you will be able to see the responses to the survey. To get back, simply click the 'Return to HubSpot Intelligence' link.

If a contact has been merged you will see a merge event on the contact timeline.

  • Navigate to the contact record
  • On the timeline look for "Contact Merge"
  • Next to this merge event you will see the email address of the contact who was merged into this record

In order to see property values that came from the secondary contact

  • Click on Property History from the contact record
  • Under the Change Source column you will see "via merge" for all activities previously associated with the secondary contact.

Further reading:

  • How to merge contacts
  • Understand what to expect when contacts are merged and the inherent implications

See all of your customers in HubSpot by creating a list of contacts whose Lifecycle Stage property is equal to Customer.

Follow the steps in this article to create a list based on contact property. Your criteria list criteria should be set to Contact Property | Lifecycle Stage | is equal to | Customer.

Related articles:

  • What is Lifecycle Stage?
  • How to segment your existing and offline contacts into groups
Google no longer supports Authorship - Please click here to create blog authors within your HubSpot Blog.

The Keywords tool reports visits and contacts from Organic Search traffic from the past 30 days.

To see Organic Search visits for your keywords for a different time frame:

  • Navigate to Reports > Sources > Organic Search
  • At the top of the report, change the "This month to date" dropdown to a different date range.

Please note: In September 2013, Google began encrypting search results for all users. This means that web analytics tools, like HubSpot, are no longer able to see the specific keywords that are bringing visitors to your website from Google searches (other search engines like Yahoo, Bing, etc. still pass along keyword data). Learn more about this change.

Related articles:

  • Understanding Keywords
  • What does "Unknown Keywords (SSL)" mean under Organic Search in the Sources Report?
  • Localizing the Keywords tool

Reports Home is a hub where you can see all of your past reports, create new reports and look into trends and suggestions based on your marketing performance. Use the Reports Home dashboard to quickly see basic numbers and statistics about your marketing and dive deeper into reports and suggestions.

1. Navigate to Reports > Reports Home

2. Analyze your Marketing Trends

At the top of the Reports Home dashboard, you will see how some of your marketing efforts are performing over the past week.

3. Compare your trends

On the Trends & Suggestions page, you can compare last week's marketing results to this week, broken down by marketing source. To filter, use the top bar. You can choose from increasing/decreasing trends, Contacts/Visits, and specific Sources buckets.

Each graph shows the comparison of Contacts or Visitors gained through the source. The graphs that are orange outline the number of Contacts gained from each source and the blue graphs show the number of visits gained. From each graph, you can be taken right to the related tool in HubSpot.

4. Manage your saved reports

From Reports Home, you can see all of the custom reports that you have created in HubSpot, in order of creation date. At the top of the Reports Home dashboard, you can filter by report type, create date, and the user who created the report.

5. Create a new report

Click on the 'Create a new report' button in the top right corner of the Reports Home dashboard to build a new report. Depending upon your HubSpot subscription level, you may have the options to create multiple types of reports:

  • Sources Report
  • Contacts Report (Enterprise Customers only)
  • Event Analysis Report (Enterprise Customers only)
  • Companies Report (Enterprise Customers only)
  • Reporting Add-On (paid add-on)

Please follow the steps noted below to replace a file in HubSpot‰Ûªs COS File Manager.

  • Navigate to Content > Content Settings > File Manager under Content Optimization System Tools.
  • Locate the file that is to be replaced > Click the Gear icon to the right-hand side of the file > select Replace.
  • You can either drag the file from your desktop into the outlined box or click the Upload a file button. If you click on the button, browse to the local copy of the file on your machine and select the replacement file. When the file has been successfully replaced the File Manager will refresh to default view.

Related Articles:

  • Why hasn't my updated file in the file manager changed?

Please follow the directions noted below to get a direct link from a file hosted on HubSpot's COS File Manager.

  • Navigate to Content > Content Settings > File Manager under the Content Optimization System Tools section.
  • Locate the file you'd like to share with others > Click the Gear icon on the right-hand side of the highlighted file > Select Get file URL to see the file's current path.
  • You can either use the link as is or specify a specific domain path via the domain drop down box in that interface (to get a more "SEO friendly" file location). Once you've configured the domain options, you can simply copy the URL for use in your content.

A few notes on file downloads and PDF docs in general:

  • Most modern browsers will open links to PDF files inside the browser itself for the visitor to view, as opposed to downloading the actual file to the visitors computer
  • In turn, whether or not a download is prompted is largely dependent on the browser in use and its settings
  • At present there is no way to force a download without using server side script, which is not supported by the HubSpot content systems
  • The visitor can always download the pdf from the subsequent window that opens, but you may want to provide a prompt above your link such as "Right click and select Save as to download" for example
  • Additionally, you could consider packaging your PDF or document file in a .zip file which will usually force the visitor to download it

Related Articles:

  • Can I remove the "cdn1/cdn2.hubspot.com" from the URL of files uploaded to the File Manager?

There is no HubSpot tool that allows you to split a list exactly in half. If you need to do this, the best option is to export your list and split it in Excel.

Related articles:

Make sure all of the following statements are true:

1. You have not purchased, rented, or leased this list from a third party.

Don’t import purchased or third party lists -- even those that promise to consist entirely of "opted in" people. Purchased lists are by definition filled with people who don’t know who you are yet, and that’s a big problem. When your email hits their inbox, they’re much more likely to mark your email as spam. This could get you suspended from sending email using HubSpot.

2. You have an unsubscribe or suppression list to go along with it.

Email lists should always come in twos. The second list is your suppression list, and should include emails that bounced, opted out, or even reported you as spam. If you’re not uploading a suppression list at the same time you’re uploading a contact list, it’s doubtful you know enough about these contacts to email them effectively.


3.You have a prior relationship with the contacts on this list.

If someone doesn’t know who you are yet, email is not the place to introduce yourself. You need to create great content and organically draw leads to you, and then engage them via email once they’ve voluntarily shared their email address with you. Anything else is just bad Outbound Marketing -- and it simply doesn’t work.


4. You have emailed these contacts within the past year.

Email addresses that are over a year old bounce at a significantly higher rate than more recently acquired email addresses. Addresses change. People change companies, ISPs, and last names. Emails that you send to stale addresses are much more likely to be hard bounced or marked as spam. If your contacts haven’t heard from you in over twelve months, it’s time to use valid inbound marketing tactics to attract them to you all over again. Honestly, it’s better that way.

Email marketing is not a situation where it's better to ask for forgiveness than permission. If you’re still not sure if your contact list is okay to use with HubSpot, please contact our email deliverability team for assistance. We're here to help.

If you’re unsure why it’s important to maintain good, high-quality contacts lists, learn why you might be suspended from sending emails in HubSpot.

Still have questions? Please reach out to your Tech Setup Engineer, Inbound Marketing Consultant, or Account Manager.

You may need to make an adjustment to your property mapping if your HubSpot form fields are not syncing to Salesforce to reflect updates. So, for example, if a contact filled out your form a month ago and told you they had 500 employees at the time, then they fill out the form again tomorrow to update that number to 550, you will want to make sure that HubSpot can sync the new information to Salesforce. Follow the steps below to make this adjustment:

  • Navigate to the Account menu > select Integrations
  • Click the gear icon next to the mapping you want to edit > choose Edit
  • Set "When should HubSpot data update the corresponding Salesforce field?" to Always


Now, any time the HubSpot property is updated, that new information will sync to Salesforce and overwrite the existing value.

Related articles:

  • How to adjust your contact field mappings‰ÛÜ
  • What does Refresh Mapping do to my mappings?

In Page Performance,your blog's RSS Subscribers is the number of daily requests for your blog's RSS feed.

  • This metric is the daily sum of requests to your blog's RSS feed through visiting the RSS feed directly (ex. visits to "blog.hubspot.com/rss.xml") or using an RSS reader to request content.
  • The value resets to 0 each day and is not cumulative.
  • Due to the nature of RSS and the RSS feed being a URL that anyone can access, it is not possible generate a list of your RSS subscribers.

Related article:

  • Where can I find my HubSpot Blog RSS Feed URL?

You can use a clicked element event to track the clicks of a download link on a website page that has the HubSpot tracking code installed. Note this solution is only available for Enterprise customers.

Follow the instructions for creating a clicked element event using the Events bookmarklet or created manually using a custom ID, class, or jQuery selector.

• Email clients do not always show images by default due to security settings and require users to click to download pictures in an email.
  • Some email clients have stricter security settings than others. This can mean that some images that you've added to your email will show while other images will not. An Email Filtering Service could be causing this, more information about this can be found here
  • When editing your email, check that you've enabled the web page version of your email to allow users with strict email settings to view your email images.
  • Alternatively, many email clients will not render very large images (10+ mbs)

Once an email has been sent, there is no way to update the text content of the email, or the sender information because the email has left HubSpot's control and is on the way (or has been received) by the recipient's email client.

However, if you are using a HubSpot CTA in your email, you can update the design and the link in that CTA, and in some email clients, the changes you make to the CTA will apply in email that the recipient sees.

  • In Outlook, the CTA is re-loaded each time the email is opened, which allows the email to pull in the style and link updates you have applied to the CTA
  • In Gmail, the first time the email is opened, the CTA will load and will remain in that same state each time they open the email - the updates to the CTA will not apply if they are made after the email is opened.
    • If you change the CTA and the recipient hasn't yet opened the email, the changes will apply the first time they open the email.

For more on updating a CTA, check out this article.

If your reading this article because you've sent an email that you want to try to cancel, contact Support as soon as possible by clicking the "Help" button in the bottom right of your HubSpot portal, and can try to stop the send.

One of the most popular uses for surveys are those based off an action taken by a sales rep. When a sales rep is working a deal, you might want them to send out a survey to assess where their biggest pain points are. Or perhaps when a deal is marked as won, you want reps to send out a survey assessing how the sales process was. Whatever your use case may be, you can do this in one of two ways if you are Salesforce integrated.

Using the workflow enrollment page in Salesforce
With our workflow enrollment page in Salesforce, a rep can enroll a contact in a HubSpot workflow from Salesforce at any time. If a workflow is set up to send out an email with a link to a survey in it, the rep can add a contact to a workflow with one click in Salesforce. You can learn more about this feature here.

Based on a contact property in Salesforce
You can also set up a smart list that is triggered off of a contact property set from Salesforce. For example, you could create a list that has the criteria of "Lifecycle Stage = Customer" that triggers a workflow that sends a survey email. This way, whenever a sales rep marks a lead as closed won, an email will be sent from HubSpot with a survey included. You could do this off of any property in Salesforce, so the possibilities are endless!

In either case, sending a survey at key points in a prospect or customer's lifecycle stage can be a great way to keep them happy and engaged!

If you are already using a CRM, you know all about the connection between contacts and companies. Want to see a company object in HubSpot? You can do this in two ways:

  • If you are using Salesforce you can enable the option to sync with Salesforce Accounts.
  • If you are using another CRM you can enable the companies object in Contacts Settings and build out an integration with our Companies API.
    • Navigate the Contacts > Contacts Settings
    • Click Display Options on the left hand sidebar
    • Select Yes under Display Company Information

After enabling the Companies object in HubSpot you will see:

  • A new group of Companies properties
  • A new section on the Contact record titled Company
  • A new list segmentation item
  • Additional workflow actions to manipulate company data
  • If you are an Enterprise customer you will have access to create Companies reports in order to do revenue reporting

• While CAN-SPAM information is present in all of your emails, any custom styling or wording on the module level will have to be done on a per template basis.

Related Articles : Can I customize my CAN-SPAM email footer?, What is CAN-SPAM?

• A Referral is traffic from a URL that does not contain any UTM tracking parameters and is from a domain that is not a known search engine, social media site, or domain listed under Reports Settings > Domains within HubSpot.
  • Ex. If a visitor clicks on a link from cnn.com to visit blog.hubspot.com, we would consider this visit a Referral from cnn.com.
  • Learn more about how HubSpot categorizes visits in the Sources Report.

The image for a contact's profile picture is determined by the following options, in order:

  • First we look at the contact's Twitter handle to see if it matches a handle in another portal with a photo. If another contact in another portal with the same Twitter handle has a profile picture, this picture will be applied to the new contact
  • If another contact cannot be found with the same Twitter handle, or if no Twitter handle is provided, we look at another source. This next source is a company called FullContact. They scrape social networks to try and look for images associated with the users social properties. This extends beyond just their Twitter handle and the Twitter network.
  • If no image is found by either of the above criteria, we use the image we have associated with their email domain. In most cases this will be their company logo.

The profile picture is gathered and applied automatically, but you can change it on a contact-by-contact basis by following the steps in this article.

Please note: pictures will not be displayed for contacts that have been imported in the HubSpot CRM without email addresses.

Note: Automatic Lifecycle Stage Transitions will still work, even if the field does not exist in Salesforce. Lifecycle Stage does not have the ability to convert a lead into a contact in Salesforce

• If you receive an error in the account setup steps when validating your tracking code, confirm that it is correctly installed on your site. Follow these instructions for verifying the installation.
  • If the tracking code is installed and firing correctly, click on the button 'I've completed this' to proceed to the next setup step.
  • Note: if you see a Error: HTTP 403 when validating the tracking code, this indicates that our our crawler might be blocked from accessing your site to detect the tracking code. Check if any user agents or crawlers are being blocked in your site's robots.txt file.

To change the logo for only a single email:

  • Navigate to Content > Email and select an email to edit
  • Scroll down to your Logo and click to edit.
    • Please note that this section is only available for templates with logo module. Check to see that you have the logo module under Settings > Edit template.
  • Click the box next to Override default logo for this page, and then click the pencil button to replace with a different image.
  • Choose an image from the File Manager or upload a new image. 
  • Click Use Image.
  • Click Done.

To change the default logo for all templates including email and COS pages, see How do I change the default logo for all templates?

In an Attribution Report chart, you will see three columns for 'Contacts assisted', '% of Contacts', and 'Score / 100'. See below to learn more about what each metric represents.

Contacts assisted:
The number of Contacts that viewed your website through a particular touchpoint before converting. For the ‰Û÷All sessions‰Ûª, ‰Û÷First and Last‰Ûª, and ‰Û÷Simple Decay‰Ûª attribution models, Contacts can be assisted by multiple touchpoints. For the other models, ‰Û÷First touch‰Ûª, ‰Û÷Last touch‰Ûª, and ‰Û÷Last interaction‰Ûª, Contacts are only assisted by a single touchpoint. This number also includes conversions that occur on the attributed page itself.

% of Contacts:
The percentage of Contacts on your list that were assisted by a particular touchpoint (number of assisted Contacts / Total Contacts on the list). Note: this percentage may not add up to 100% depending upon the attribution model used. For the ‰Û÷All sessions‰Ûª, ‰Û÷First and Last‰Ûª, and ‰Û÷Simple Decay‰Ûª models, Contacts can be assisted by multiple touchpoints.

Score / 100:
The score represents the value of a touchpoint leading to Contact conversions. Touchpoints with higher scores are considered more valuable because they are attributed to the most Contacts. The score for a touchpoint is calculated based on the points received from Contacts‰Ûª interactions. Learn more about how this score is calculated.

To protect the reputation of HubSpot and our customers we ask that anyone who uses the HubSpot email application maintain a high deliverability rate. If your email has been suspended, the Email Deliverability team will reach out to you within 24 hours.

In the case the circumstances are more immediate, you can reach out to HubSpot Support here.

In order to create a Companies Report, you must be an Enterprise Customer syncing Company properties using the Salesforce Integrationor the Companies API.

  1. Navigate to Reports > Reports Home > Create a new report.
  2. Choose Companies Report > select 'Start From Scratch'> Create Report.
  3. Click on the title at the top of the report to edit the name of your report.


  4. Select a list (or create a new list) to segment on.
  5. Select a conversion type (ex. Close Date, Create Date, Recent Conversion Date, etc) and a time period for your report.
  6. Choose to group companies by day, week, or month.
  7. Optional: choose a company property to further breakdown this report. This data will display in a chart below the graph.
  8. Optional: choose a numeric property to calculate the total value and sum value. This data will also display in a chart below the graph.

The is equal to list operator necessitates an exact match.

  • Example: if you create a list with the criteria Favorite travel destinations | is equal to | Australia, a contact whose Favorite travel destinations property contains both Australia and Brazil will not join the list.

The contains the word list operator does not require an exact match.

  • Example: if you create a list with the criteria Favorite travel destinations | contains the word | Australia, the contact above (with two favorite travel destinations) will join the list.

Related articles:

  • How do I make a list based on a property?
  • How can I create a custom contact property?

This is not currently possible - Enterprise Events require that the HubSpot JavaScript tracking code is installed on the page, which is not supported in emails.

  • If the link in the email is to a page that contains the HubSpot tracking code, then we recommend creating a Visited URL Event instead.
  • If the link in the email is to a page that does not contain the HubSpot tracking code, then you will be able to see who clicked on the link within the Email tool. Navigate to Content > Email > click on the name of your email > change the dropdown from 'Filter by status' to 'Clicked' > change the dropdown from 'Filter by a specific link' to your desired URL.

If you are not integrated with Salesforce, you can use the default property, HubSpot Owner, to automatically trigger lead revisit notifications for your users. This property will pull the Owner name and email address from the users currently associated with your account.

Assigning a HubSpot Owner to a single Contact

  • Navigate to All Contacts > locate and click on the name of your unassigned Contact.
  • On the left side of the Contact record, in the About card, click View all properties.
  • Use the search bar to find the property labeled HubSpot Owner > click into the text box to select an Owner for this lead from your account's users.
  • Click Done to save your changes.


Assigning a HubSpot Owners to multiple Contacts

To assign owners to your existing Contacts, you can update the HubSpot Owner property for multiple Contacts at a time using a workflow or by manually editing Contacts' HubSpot Owner properties. To setup owner assignment rules for future Contacts, you can also use a workflow or add a hidden field to forms.

Customize User Notification Settings

    • No leads: Choose this option to turn revisit notifications off for a user.
    • All leads in the contacts database: Choose this option to receive lead revisit alerts for every Contact in the database.

• Effective July 1, 2014 CASL is Canada’s anti-spam legislation, it is similar to CAN-SPAM in that it protects consumers against receiving unwanted email but different in that it is much more specific about permission and what is considered "opt in".


    Under CAN-SPAM, an organization can technically send email marketing campaigns initially without consent, but must provide an opt-out method and honor requests immediately (however, HubSpot does not allow this practice). CASL requires organizations to obtain permission before sending any communication. CASL also requires senders maintain proof of opt-in, including the source and time.

    The bottom line: if you don't know how your contacts provided consent to hear from you, don't email them.

  • You should review the CASL with your own counsel.If you use HubSpot as your email service provider, you have the tools you need to run a CASL-compliant email marketing program. See more at A Guide to the New Canadian Anti-Spam Legislation (CASL).

Related Articles: A Guide to the New Canadian Anti-Spam Legislation (CASL), How to send contacts an email with an opt-out link so they can manage their preferences, How do I customize my email subscription pages?, What is CAN-SPAM?, Can I customize my CAN-SPAM email footer?

• HubSpot sends email on your behalf using our shared email servers. SPF is used to verify the identity of that server, so we already have an SPF policy to cover this shared system. Therefore you don't have to add anything to your DNS.

  • If you're looking for email authentication but don't qualify for a dedicated IP, consider DKIM email authentication for an added layer of security.

• I don‰Ûªt see any visits; is my tracking code installed correctly?
  • I see the tracking code installed correctly on my website; how do I know if it is firing correctly?
  • I don‰Ûªt see any visits today (but I did yesterday) is my tracking code working?

How to verify that the tracking code is installed correctly:

  1. Verify your HubSpot ID (Hub ID). If you do not know your Hub ID, navigate to your HubSpot Dashboard. Your Hub ID appears in the top right corner (in the navigation bar).
  2.  Open a page on your website in your browser and right-click on the screen.
  3.  Select View page source or View source.
  4. The next screen will show all of the code that makes up your website. To find out if the HubSpot tracking code is installed, use the keyboard shortcut ctrl f or cmd f to bring up the search field. Search for [your Hub ID].js - for example: 369684.js

    Please note: if you are using Google Tag Manager or another script loader, the tracking code will not appear in the page source. Follow the steps below to check the Network tab and ensure that the code is firing corrently.

  • If the tracking code is not found on your website, learn more about how to install HubSpot's tracking code.
  • If the tracking code is installed on your website, verify that the code has been copied and pasted correctly from Reports > Reports Settings > Tracking Code.

How to verify that the tracking code is firing correctly:

  1. Open a page on your website in your browser and right-click on the screen.
  2. Select Inspect Element (or Inspect). You will see a toolbar appear at the bottom of your screen.

  3. Click on the Network tab, then refresh your page. Within the Network tab you will now see the Name, Method, Status, Type, etc. for all of the elements loading on your webpage.
     

  4. Click on the Name column to sort alphabetically, then scroll to the top of the list.
  5. Look for [your Hub ID].js in the Name column - for example: 369684.js. If you do not know your Hub ID, navigate to your HubSpot Dashboard. Your Hub ID appears in the top right corner (in the navigation bar).
  6. Next to [your Hub ID].js you should see 304 Not Modified or 200 OK in the Status column.
  7. If you see any other status (or the .js code is not found), your tracking code may not be firing correctly. Please contact HubSpot Support for further troubleshooting.

Another way to determine whether or not your tracking code is firing correctly is to navigate to Reports > Page Performance, and search for one of your external pages. Change the date range to display Today, and check to see if there are visits to your pages. If there are, that means that your tracking code is firing. If you are not seeing your pages appear, it is likely that either the tracking code is not installed correctly, or the pages have not had tracked views in the time range selected.

How to determine why expected visits are not appearing on the Dashboard or in the Sources Report:

HubSpot‰Ûªs analytics update every 1-3 hours; data will not appear in your reports immediately. To see the last time that the analytics were updated, navigate to Reports > Sources.  Scroll to the bottom of the screen; you will see Data last updated: X hours ago. If it has been more than 3 hours since the analytics updated, visit status.hubspot.com to check if there is a known issue with HubSpot displaying analytics data.

Related articles:

  • How do I install the HubSpot Tracking Code on my website? 
  • Why am I not seeing any page visits even though the HubSpot tracking code is firing on my website?

When attempting to enable the Salesforce Account Sync, you may not be able to turn the sync on without first making changes to HubSpot or Salesforce. If the requirements for the Account Sync are not met, you will see the option to turn the sync grayed out with a blue information icon. For steps on enabling the Account Sync, refer here.

By clicking the blue information icon, you will get an explanation of why the Account Sync cannot currently be enabled.

In some cases, you may not be able to turn the sync on without making changes inside of Salesforce. An example of this is if the Integration User (the person whose credentials are entered in HubSpot) does not have access to see certain fields critical to the sync:

If you see an error relating to field access, first attempt to give the Integration User appropriate permissions by following the steps listed here. If adding the permission set is unsuccessful, ensure that the Integration User has read access to the fields listed. Updating the profile of the Integration User to System Administrator may also solve permission errors. Once you have completed these steps, click 'Check Again'. If an error still persists, contact HubSpot Support.

Note: HubSpot does not support using the Account Sync with Person Accounts. For more information, please refer to this knowledge article.

Yes, it is possible to sync Person Accounts with HubSpot, though there are some things to be aware of.
  • HubSpot currently does not have the ability to create Person Accounts. When creating a new contact in HubSpot, these should be created as leads in Salesforce. Once the lead is created you may convert them to either person accounts or business accounts in Salesforce. Learn more about this here: https://help.salesforce.com/apex/HTViewHelpDoc?id=leads_notes.htm&language=en_US. If you have selected to create Salesforce contacts when a contact is created in HubSpot, a standard contact record will be created which may be associated with a Business Account but not a Person Account.
  • When creating a new Person Account in Salesforce, this will create a new contact in HubSpot (when auto-add is enabled) and begin syncing as normal.
  • If you require the ability to create Person Accounts when a record is created in HubSpot you may build a custom integration via the HubSpot Contacts API or through a certified HubSpot Partner, however, both of these methods are not able to be supported by HubSpot Support

A click-to-call button or link on your website makes it easy for mobile users to quickly reach your office by phone with a single click. To add click-to-call functionality to your website, you'll need to add the following tag to the html source code of a rich text module or directly into an HTML module on your layout.

The Markup:
The HTML markup for a click-to-call link is below. Simply replace the 5555555555 with your company's phone number, no spaces or dashes.

<a href="tel:5555555555">Call Us</a>

If you have a phone icon and would like to create a click-to-call button, you can use the following markup to do so, replacing both the example phone number and the image tag's source code to match your company's phone number and the appropriate location of your file in your file manager.

<a href="tel:5555555555"><img src="http://www.domain.com/files/phone-icon.jpg"></a>

HubSpot's Sources Report helps you measure the success of your marketing campaigns over time and find areas for further optimization. It shows you where your traffic is coming from, as well as the original source of your leads and customers. As you increase your social media presence on social sites like Facebook, LinkedIn, Twitter, etc, you will be able to see measure your impact in the Sources Report.

Learn how to track which social media channels are generating the most traffic.

1. Navigate to the Sources Report

2. Select a Date Range

Above the Sources graph, select a time range to analyze. Choose "This month to date" to see your performance for the current month.

3. Filter by Social Media

Below the graph, you will see a chart displaying the different sources that your traffic is coming from. Click on Social Media.

4. Compare performance of all social media channels

View the different social media sites that are bringing traffic to your site.

5. Drill down into your marketing campaigns

By selecting a specific social site, you can see how your campaigns are performing. Select Facebook for this example. You can then see the breakdown of all of your campaigns and how they are performing individually. This gives you the ability to track which of the campaigns on social media are driving the best visitors, leads, and customers to your site.

6. Create a plan based on observations

  • If you see that a particular social media site is sending you quality traffic and leads, you should focus your attention on participating more on that site.
  • Look at individual campaigns and see what you are doing right.
  • Ask yourself what it is about that site or your actions on it that could be responsible for your success there.
  • If you can, replicate what you are doing there on other social media sites!

7. Make sure that visits from social media are being bucketed correctly

  • When posting content to social media, learn more about the correct setup to ensure visits are bucketed correctly in the Sources Report.

When a person visits your site, HubSpot tracks their activity with the HubSpot tracking code. HubSpot identifies unique visitors by placing a tracking cookie on their browser.

HubSpot tracks visitors' activity on your site even before they convert on a form. Once the visitor does fill out a form or gets otherwise added as a Contact, HubSpot will try to associate the record with any activity that was tracked previously. If HubSpot analytics is able to match a new Contact with an anonymous visitor whose activity we were previously tracking, we will update the Original Source Type property to reflect the source of the Contact's earliest visit to your site. An example of when the Original Source Type property might change:

  • A Contact visits your website for the first time in March by clicking on a result from a Google search.
  • He clicks on a few website pages, but does not submit a form to become a Contact. Even though he is not yet a Contact, HubSpot still "sees" his activity and tracks him as the same visitor if he revisits the site again.
  • In July, you import his email address from a .csv list, which would give him the Original Source Type of 'Offline'.
  • The Contact is then sent an email from HubSpot and he clicks on a link in the email to visit your site again.
  • The identity tracking added to links in HubSpot emails and the cookie that was already in his browser from his first Google search back in March allow HubSpot to identify the imported Contact with his website visits.
  • The Contact's Original Source Type will change from 'Offline' to 'Organic Search' because his first interaction with your website was through the Google search in March - earlier than his offline import in July.

Following in a similar path, another example of when a contact's Original Source Type may change from 'Offline' to another value is via Form Submission. When a contact for which HubSpot already has a cookie placed within his/her browser, and has a value of 'Offline' for Original Source Type (because as described above the contact may have been imported), submits on a form on your website the contact's Original Source Type may change, for example:

  • From 'Offline' to 'Organic Search' because his/her first interaction with your website was through a Google, Bing, or Yahoo search.
  • From 'Offline' to 'Direct Traffic' because his/her first interaction was to visit your site directly.

 

Related articles:

  • What do the properties Original Source Data 1 and 2 mean?
  • How does HubSpot categorize Visits, Contacts, and Customers in the Sources Report?

As you may know, one way to create contacts in your HubSpot portal is to simply import a list of such. When these first time contacts are imported, they are assigned the Original Source Type of 'Offline'. However, after import HubSpot will begin to track them when:

  1. They convert on a HubSpot or HubSpot connected form OR
  2. They click through a HubSpot email message that directs them to a HubSpot page or external, non-HubSpot page that has the HubSpot tracking code.

Once HubSpot begins to track them, lead intelligence is collected as they progress through your marketing funnel.

 

Related articles:

  • Why did my contact's Original Source Type change?

  • Creates whitespace in your content, which is more visually appealing than dense paragraphs of text

Here's how to create lists in your content using the CMS:

Click the orange Edit button above the module in which you'll be adding your list.

Click the ordered list icon if you want to create a numbered list.

If a HubSpot contact attempts to sync to Salesforce, but is unable to do so successfully, the failure will be indicated by a warning symbol and message within the Salesforce Sync section on the contact record.

Additionally, you can view all of your portal's sync errors by navigating to the Account Menu > Integrations > Salesforce Settings > Sync Errors. (Learn more about fixing these errors in this help article.)

All contacts with errors will automatically be retried by HubSpot every 20 minutes up to ten times. Once a record has errored ten times it will be placed in a "timeout queue," and retried with all other errored records in this queue every night at midnight GMT.

Errored records can also be forcibly retried from the contact record (by clicking the Resync button in the Salesforce Sync section), or in bulk by navigating to the Sync Errors screen, selecting Details for a particular error and clicking Retry syncing contacts.

Because retrying syncs may use significant resources in the form of API calls and Salesforce data storage (HubSpot Logs/Log Messages), syncs will not retry if one of three conditions are met:

  1. There is no HubSpot API Call Limit and HubSpot has used more than 5,000 API calls in the past 24 hours
  2. HubSpot has used more than 75% of the HubSpot API Call Limit
  3. We have attempted to sync the record 10 times and have received an error on each.

HubSpot will not allow errored syncs to retry once one of these thresholds has been met in order to preserve the remaining API calls for new syncs that may occur. You can find more information regarding your HubSpot API call usage by navigating to Account Menu > Integrations > Salesforce Settings > API Call Limit. You can resume the syncing of these errors by waiting for more API calls to become available or by raising the HubSpot API Call Limit.

Once you have addressed the errors prohibiting contacts from syncing, the corresponding HubSpot Logs may be deleted from Salesforce in order to decrease overall data usage by following the steps listed here.

 

Related articles:

  • Why isn't a contact syncing to Salesforce?
  • How to troubleshoot issues with your Salesforce integration

Prior to November 1, 2013, HubSpot Forms did not have the functionality to record analytic data for submissions and as a result could cause limited data to display on the Form analytics screen.

  • If you set a custom date range for a period before November 1, 2013, you will not see the views, submissions, or submission rate reflected on this screen.
    • This does not mean the form has no submissions, rather, these metrics were not yet recorded to display here.
  • If the HubSpot tracking code is not on your website, you will not see the views, submissions, or submission rate.
  • If you are using the Forms API, you will not see the views or submission rate increase.
    • Views are registered when the form embed code loads, if there is no form embed code on the page you will never see the number of views increase.

Additional troubleshooting tips:

  • Ensure the date range is correct
  • Ensure the submission wasn't made from a filtered IP address
  • The form analytics dash updates with sources

One way to see form submissions from a certain date range is to create a list based on that form submission and refine by date. See this article for more information about segmenting your lists with rolling date ranges.

You can also export form submission data and organize it by date in Excel.

Another way to view form submissions within a particular date range is to look at the performance of the landing page on which your form is located.

Related articles:

  • How can I create a list based off of form submissions?

Font Awesome is a font of scalable vector icons that can be customized by size, color, and just about any attribute that can be changed with CSS. Follow these steps to install Font-Awesome on the COS:

  • Copy all of the code from this HubSpot-hosted font-awesome file. Make sure you select all of the code.
  • Paste the code into your CSS file. To be more specific, navigate to Content > Design Manager, locate and access your stylesheet, paste the code just copied from Step 1 within your stylesheet, and save it appropriately.
  • Publish your CSS file.

Now you are ready to use Font Awesome! Font awesome will be applied to elements with class="fa" and a class specific to the icon that you would like to render (example class="fa-facebook"). Please note that Font-Awesome icons will not work in Email.

Also, please be aware that <i class=...> elements cannot be used with the Source Code of our WYSIWYG editors. When trying to implement Font Awesome Icons, it is best to use <span> tags as noted in the example below:

<h2>Font Awesome Icons Example</h2>
<ul class="fa-ul">
<li><span class="fa-twitter fa"></span>Twitter Icon</li>
<li><span class="fa-list-ul fa"></span>List Icon</li>
<li><span class="fa fa-camera-retro fa-lg fa"></span>Camera Icon</li>
</ul>

If you are using HubSpot's default Hubtheme, font-awesome is already included in hubtheme-foundation.css, and you can use the shortcodes described in this article to render font icons. Please note that the shortcodes are only available in Hubtheme (they require a special Javascript file).

Alternative to Steps 1-3

As an alternative to copying the font-awesome code into your existing CSS file, you could add the following link tag to the head tag of your Content Settings or Template Head Tag HTML section:

<link href="http://designers.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hub/327485/file-2054199286-css/font-awesome.css" rel="stylesheet">

Please note that the HubSpot-hosted version of Font Awesome is not kept up to date. If you want to use newer icons that are not listed here, you will want to upload your own font files into File Manager and replace the @font-face reference with their src urls.

Within the File Manager, one can change the File URL for uploaded files.

  • First, please navigate to Content > File Manager.
  • Once in the File Manager page, locate the desired file, click the Gear Icon beside the name of file and select Get File URL.
  • Under Select the Domain for your File, use the drop-down to choose the domain for your file's URL. Under Select the Domain for your File, use the drop-down to choose the domain for your file's URL.
  • Simply copy the newer URL for use in your content. Please note that if you do not have any domains listed in the drop-down, you will have to go to Content > Content Settings > Domain Manager to Connect Another HubSpot COS Domain.

Related Articles:

  • How to replace a file in HubSpot's file manager

As is the case with other social networks, LinkedIn posts with images are proven to generate more clicks and engagement.

Currently, you are able to directly attach an image in your LinkedIn post only when publishing to a LinkedIn company account. Attaching an image when posting to LinkedIn personal pages or groups is not possible at this time. If you are adding a link to your LinkedIn post, you will be able to select a featured image for that link when posting to either a company or a personal LinkedIn account.

  • When composing a new message in the Social tool (Social > Publishing), the Image option will appear in the Attach dropdown only if a LinkedIn Company page has been selected. If you select a personal LinkedIn account, this option will not appear in the dropdown.

  • When you add a link to the LinkedIn message you are composing in HubSpot, you may select an image from the page being shared to be displayed as the featured image for the message.

Views and Submissions from filtered IP addresses will not appear on the Form Analytics screen.

  • We do not count these views and submissions in order to report an accurate conversion rate for just your leads and customers.
    • If a submission is done from a filtered IP address it is considered a test submission and will not dilute these metrics.
  • Test submissions will still appear on the individual Contact record and on the Form Submissions screen.
    • If a submission was made from a filtered IP address you will see a a message at the top of the contact record: "This contact's IP address is filtered out. Their views and submissions won't be recorded in analytics"
  • You can still create a list based off of form submissions and these contacts will be added to it.

Please note: This also applies to the views, submissions, and conversion rate in the Landing Pages and Calls-to-Action applications.

Additional troubleshooting steps if the submission was not made from a filtered IP address:

  • Ensure the date range is correct
  • The form analytics dash updates with sources
  • Make sure the tracking code is installed and the form isn't being submitted through the Forms API

The instructions below will show you how to create a checkbox field, which allows users to subscribe to your blog while filling out any form. Please note: this functionality is only available to Professional and Enterprise customers with the HubSpot COS blog.

Create a checkbox contact property.

  • Set the Field Type to Single On/Off Checkbox (checked = "yes, subscribe me to the blog")

Add the new blog subscription checkbox to any form where you want it to be available.

  • Navigate to Contacts > Forms
  • Edit your forms by clicking on the name of the form
  • Drag your blog subscription checkbox property onto the default questions section of the form

Use Lists and Workflows to add new subscribers to the default blog subscription.

  • Create a smart list of contacts who opted in using that checkbox
  • Create a workflow and set the list you created above as the starting condition
  • The first step of the workflow should set a contact property value (there is a default blog subscription property called "name of blog Email Subscription" - set the value to Instant or the desired frequency)
  • Activate the workflow

Check out this blog article for an in-depth walk-through of the process described above.

There are a few potential reasons why you might not be receiving your marketing reports from HubSpot via email. See below for an outline of possible causes.

First, make sure the notifications you're expecting are set up to send to you.

  • Click on the Account menu in the top, right-hand corner of your account (next to your domain name and Hub ID) > click Settings > choose My Email and Push Notifications from the left-hand sidebar - review which emails are enabled here

Now, check your junk folder.

  • Sometimes emails from HubSpot end up in junk or spam folders in your inbox
  • Add noreply@hubspot.com and success@hubspot.com to your email address book to ensure that notification emails make it to your inbox

Please remember: there are several potential reasons why you might not receive an email you expect. If the above information does not resolve the issue, please review this article.

The information noted below explains how this testing feature works. Please click here if you would like to learn how actually create an A/B test email.

Please note email A/B testing is only available for HubSpot Marketing Professional and Enterprise accounts.

1000 contacts+

  • Your total send list must include at least 1,000 contacts to run an A/B test. This is because we need at least that large a sample size to gather statistically significant A/B test results.
  • You can select any sample size to test and we will send the winning version to the remaining percentage of the recipient list.
  • Because your contacts will not always open and read your emails right away, you will need to specify a time limit on how long we'll gather results before choosing a winning version.

Fewer than 1000 contacts

  • If you have fewer than 1000 contacts in your send you can choose to run a 50/50 test instead. Otherwise,we'll send the entire list to the version you specify in the "Version to send if sample too low" selector.
  • If you choose to run a 50/50 test, you don't need to pick a timeframe or winning version metric.

Email subscription pages are created as system templates, rather than individual pages. The way they render depends upon the recipient's email preferences. To edit these templates:

  • Navigate to Content > Content Settings > Email > Subscription Settings.
  • Select a template to use for each of your subscription pages in the corresponding dropdown menus.
  • If you do not have an existing custom template for your pages, click on View template next to the dropdown menu.
  • When prompted to clone the template, click Clone.
  • Name your new template (located in Template Builder under Custom/System/Subscription Preferences).
  • To edit the content of your template, click the gear icon > Edit Options.
  • Once you have made your changes, click Done.
  • Click Publish Changes. The template will now be available to select under Content Settings.
  • If you wish to preview the template you just edited, click on the Preview button near the top of the template.

Types of Email Subscription Pages

  • Subscription Preference Page - This page features a name and description of each email type defined in under Content > Content Settings > Email > Email Types. Users can choose which type of email communications they'd like to receive from your organization or unsubscribe from all communications on this page.
  • Unsubscribe Backup Page - This page is loaded for visitors who aren't recognized in your portal's Contacts database at the time of their visit, and allows visitors to manually enter their information to unsubscribe from future email communications.
  • Subscription Update Confirmation Page - This page confirms that our system has received a request to update communication preferences for a visitor. This page is displayed after a user saves their preferences on the Subscription Preference Page, or after the user clicks the Unsubscribe from all emails link from an email they received.

To create a flexible column on your HubSpot Website page or Landing page templates:

  • Click Content > Design Manager
  • Open a template for editing
  • Add a few modules to the template that can be paired in a group (try to add a few common defaults that marketers will most likely need)
  • Click the "Group" button at the top of Design Manager and click on the modules that should appear within that flex column by default
  • Click the blue "Create Group" button to create the group
  • Click the gear icon drop down in the newly created group and select the "Make Flexible Column" option
  • Click Publish Changes to save your work

Please note: You cannot make a flexible column within an Email template or Blog template - this can only be done in a Website or Landing Page template. 

You also won't be able to make a group into a flexible column if you have split modules within the group; all modules have to be full width. For example, the group below cannot be made into a flexible column because it has two modules that were split horizontally:

Flexible columns were designed to make content management at the page-level easier for content creators. When a flexible column is added to a HubSpot page template, users will be given the option, within the content editor interface, to add, remove, and re-order modules, at the page-level. This feature allows designers to create fewer templates, while still allowing marketers the flexibility to customize each page to fit their needs. Please note that there is no option to make flexible columns within blog templates or emails.

If your fields in HubSpot do not appear to be sending data to Salesforce, there may be a few explanations.

  • Make sure you're using the correct fields in your form
    • Check to be sure that you don't have fields with similar or duplicate names. If two properties exist in your portal with the same label, that label will appear twice in the UI.
    • Do a test submission of the form to see which fields are populated.
    • Verify that the field on your form is the one mapped with Salesforce (in HubSpot, Account Menu in the top-right > Integrations > Salesforce > Settings > Contact Field Mappings).
  • If you see that everything appears to be correct, but Salesforce is overwriting the value (check the contact's property history), you may need to change the field's update rule. To edit an update rule, select Edit from the Gear Icon menu to the right of the Field Mapping.

  • For an explanation of the update rule options, please see What do the different update rules for my field mappings mean?

Previous versions of the HubSpot-Salesforce integration relied heavily on custom Salesforce objects and Apex code to facilitate the sync between HubSpot and Salesforce. Most of the changes from versions pre-2.60 and versions post-2.60 don't affect the behavior of the sync in any functional way, but the changes reduce the amount of data storage required for the HubSpot managed package, reduce the overal number of daily API calls, greatly reduce the number of custom objects, reduce the amount of Apex code, and eliminate issues related to Salesforce governor limits. The reductions are aimed to be more considerate of Salesforce-side quotas and limits that HubSpot-Integrated Salesforce users may have run into through normal use of the integration.

The new connector still requires a managed package and one custom obect (object API name: HubSpot_Inc__HubSpot_Intelligence__c) to serve the HubSpot Intelligence VisualForce pages on Salesforce lead and contact layouts. If you are upgrading your HubSpot-Salesforce integration from a version pre-2.60, all HubSpot custom objects (with the exception of the HubSpot Intelligence object) will be deprecated and can be deleted entirely from your Salesforce organization. You can delete these objects from the Objects settings of your Salesforce environment (usually in Setup > Create > Objects). After the upgrade to 2.60, any object with a 'Del' option can be deleted; you will not be able to delete the HubSpot Intelligence object. 

Deprecated Objects

Important Note Regarding HubSpot Activities

The HubSpot Activity object will be deprecated and is no longer supported on versions of the managed package later than 2.60. If you are syncing HubSpot Activites to the HubSpot Activity object (object API name: HubSpot_Inc__HubSpot_Activity__c ), the integration will continue to sync HubSpot Activity records, however we recommend syncing Form and Email interactions (sent/opened/clicked) as Salesforce Activities. Using the Salesforce's native activity type allows for more flexible reporting by default and saves on data storage within Salesforce. For more information, please see this section of our Salesforce integration user guide.

Related Articles:

  • What are Salesforce Activities?
  • A quick tour of the Salesforce integration

• If you are connected to Salesforce your HubSpot property may be getting changed back to its original value by Salesforce.
  • Most Salesforce field mappings by default are set to only update if not valued in Salesforce. In your situation a property change may have been sent over to Salesforce, but Salesforce didn't change its existing value, and then passed its unchanged value back to HubSpot.
  • You can set Salesforce field updates to "always", "never", or "only if not valued." These settings can be managed on a per field basis from the Contact Field Mappings screen in HubSpot (For a full explanation of the update rules, please see What do the different update rules for my field mappings mean?)

After navigating to the Contact Field Mappings screen (Profile Picture Dropdown > Integrations > Salesforce Settings > Contact Field Mappings), click the cog icon for the field you would like to edit, and choose edit: Next, choose the new Update Rule, and click Save Mapping:

Next, choose the new Update Rule, and click Save Mapping:

Please follow the directions noted below to upgrade to the latest version of the HubSpot-Salesforce integration.

  • Navigate to your Account Menu > select Integrations.
  • Under Salesforce, click on Update Package.
  • Click on the Update your package button.
  • On the Update Salesforce Package window, click on Upgrade your connector - Doing so will drive you to your Salesforce instance and prompt you to update to the latest version. Once you have finished this step in Salesforce, return to HubSpot.
  • Next, click on Refresh your package info - This will refresh your version within HubSpot.
  • Congratulations, you have upgraded to the latest version of the HubSpot-Salesforce integration.

What is an event?

An event is a feature available for Enterprise HubSpot customers that allows you to track when a user performs a specific action on your website. Common examples include:

  • A visitor signed up for trial
  • A visitor downloaded a whitepaper
  • The free demo button was clicked
  • A user logged in
  • A prospect created an account
  • The pricing page was viewed

What do I need to get started?

  • The Events tool is only available to customers on the Enterprise package.
  • The HubSpot tracking code must be installed on any page that you wish to track events on.

How do I create an event?

  • Navigate to Reports > Events > Click on the button to 'Create new event'.
  • Choose your event type:

Visited URL Events: An event is triggered when a visitor visits a specific URL.
Clicked Element Events: An event is triggered when a page element is clicked.
Submitted Form Events: An event is triggered when a visitor submits a HubSpot form.
Custom Events: An event is triggered based on custom JavaScript or HTTP API requests.

What are the Event Types?

Visited URL Event

  • Add tag(s) to organize your events.

If you're using SSL, you will want to keep protocols in mind (http versus https) - if you want to track a URL that utilizes SSL and contains "https" within said URL, you will want to make sure you write "https" here.

Note: You can also use wildcards in the URL to have the event fire for a range of pages. For example, using * at the end of a URL will allow the event to fire on any pages that contain the first part of the URL. For example, if all of your blog URLs begin with http://blog.example.com/ you can use http://blog.example.com/* to fire the event for all of the blog URLs. This means that the event would fire for pages like http://blog.example.com/amazing-blog-post, http://blog.example.com/more-awesome-blog-post, etc.

Clicked Element Event

We recommend using the Events Bookmarklet to generate clicked element events, see more instructions about this setup. Otherwise, you can manually create a clicked element event using an id, class, or jQuery selector.

  • Enter the ID, Class, or a jQuery selector for the element on your website page that you want to track clicks on. Ex. if you had an image on your page with this HTML <img id="webinar-offer-image" src="/webinar-march.png"/> the ID would be webinar-offer-image.
  • Specify a page URL that will limit the Event to only triggering for visitors that click on the element on that specific URL. If you want this event to fire on all page, leave the page URL blank.
  • Associate a conversion value that will appear in your rvent report if you want to measure the return of an investment with this event.
  • Add tag(s) to organize your events.

Submitted Form Event

  • Select the HubSpot form that you want to trigger the event. Forms that are submitted to HubSpot via the Forms API are also included in the dropdown list of forms.
  • Specify a page URL that will limit the event to only triggering for visitors that submit the form on that page. If you want this event to fire on all page, leave the page URL blank.
  • Add tag(s) to organize your events.

Custom Events

Creating custom events requires a developer to write custom JavaScript to submit an event to HubSpot when certain conditions are met. The API documentation for creating custom events is available on the Developers forum. There are two types of custom events: Custom JavaScript events and HTTP API events.

  • Custom JavaScript Events

When a page is loaded and the HubSpot tracking code is executed, we create a variable _hsq which acts as a queue that you can push tracking events onto. You can add events to be tracked by setting the variable _hsq to an array and filling it with event calls. You can call methods by specifying the method name and arguments, ex. _hsq.push(["method", "arg1", "arg2"]); Variables should correspond to Contact property keys in order for their values to appear correctly in Contacts' records.

  • Add your JavaScript code to create your custom event. The JavaScript will automatically be included whenever your HubSpot tracking code is loaded.
  • Specify a page URL that will limit the event to only triggering for visitors that visit that page. If you want this event to fire on all page, leave the page URL blank.
  • Add tag(s) to organize your events.
  • Custom Events using the HTTP API

You can also track an event by hitting the URL provided when creating a custom HTTP API Event. The Events tool will provide a URL that contains various query parameters. Requests against 'track.hubspot.com' should be made using GET (both HTTP and HTTPS are supported).

  • The two required parameters are: "_n"(the Event's unique identifier ) and "email" (the email address of the Contact that triggered the event).

  • To generate your event's id: click on the button in the Event to 'Create Report' > click to View the saved event > Edit Event > click the link to Use the HTTP API. The id will now be included as a parameter within the request URL.

For further insight, please follow the resources linked below.

  • Events user guide

All contacts in HubSpot must have an email address. If the link in a form submission notification email takes you to a contact record that does not have an email address, that contact has not actually been created in HubSpot.

You may still receive form submission notification emails when the form is submitted, even if no email address is included. This can occur if:

  • You are using a custom form with the Forms API and the form does not require an email address to submit and no cookie is passed - can happen when disable cookie tracking is set to "Yes"
  • Your HubSpot form does not include the default email field and no cookie is passed - can happen when disable cookie tracking is set to "Yes"
  • The email field on your HubSpot form is smart/not required and no cookie is passed - can happen when disable cookie tracking is set to "Yes"

We recommend making the default HubSpot Email field a required, non-smart field on all of your forms to ensure that contact information is always captured. No notification email will be sent from a form submission if a contact does not provide an email address to the default email field AND the contact has not been tracked by a HubSpot cookie.

Related articles:

  • Why do I have more form submissions than contacts?
  • Why are my contacts not being created with my custom email field?

HubSpot has default validation for email addresses. You also have the option to prevent users with email addresses at certain domains from submitting your form.

You can also turn on validation for the length of the default phone number field in HubSpot.

Customized form validation rules can be written using JavaScript, but the form embed code no longer supports the addition of custom validation JS, directly in the embed. The HubSpot Forms API is also publicly available if you and your developer choose to build a completely custom form, but want submissions to pass into HubSpot.

Related articles:

  • How to do I stop spam form submissions?
  • Blog: Improved Validation & Domain Blocking in HubSpot Forms

After updating a CTA (Call-to-Action) that has been included in an email that has already been sent, you may wonder if the newer version of the CTA will show in the email message present on the recipients' inbox.

  • The newer version of the CTA will not be shown on the email that has already been sent. Once an email message reaches a recipient's inbox, the content will stay as it is.
  • However, if you created a web page version for the email before you sent it out, the newer version of the CTA will show in the email's web page version.

Related Articles:

  • How do I edit my Call-to-Action?
  • How do I create a web page version of an email?

In order to create a web page version of your email, it is not necessary to create an additional page to be the 'web page version'. It is much easier than that! When the 'web page version' option is enabled in your email draft's settings, a new web page is automatically generated using the contents of your email. You will still need to specify basic details for the web page such as a page URL, meta description, and page title.

  • Navigate to Content > Email.
  • Click on the Gear icon > Edit next to the email you want to edit.
  • Go to Settings > Web Version and switch to turn your web version email from Off to On.
  • You will have the option to redirect the web-based email to a landing page at a scheduled date and time. For example, if you have a 24 hour offer, you can choose your homepage as the page to redirect to 24 hours after your email is scheduled to go out.
  • You will also have the option to update the Page Status of the web version email after it has been sent.
  • The email's web page version URL will function after a valid URL is entered and saved. This means that the web page version will be live in the draft version of your email.
If the Web Version setting is not available under the Settings tab:
  • In the email editor, go to Settings > Edit Template.
  • Additionally, check that the {{ view_as_page_url }} token is present in Edit Options > Tools > Source Code.
  • The code will look something like this:

{%raw %} {%if content.create_page%} <div style="padding-top: 15px; font-family: Geneva, Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; text-align: right; font-size: 9px; line-height: 1.34em; color: {{secondary_font_color}};">Not rendering correctly? View this email as a web page <a href="{{view_as_page_url}}" target="_blank" data-viewaswebpage="true" style="color: {{secondary_font_color}}; text-decoration: underline; white-space: nowrap">here</a>.</div> {%endif%} {% endraw %}

  • Custom coded templates must contain either the {%raw %} {{view_as_page_section}}{% endraw %} or the {%raw %} {{view_as_page_url}}{% endraw %} token.

Related Articles:

  • How do I update the web page version of my email?
